    • Field Detail

      • dTan

        public float dTan
        Warning: This should be changed as a last resort
        It is used when calculating the tangent to the path Although the user specifies 3 functions to determine the x,y,z coordinates of a point it would be difficult for the user to specify the formulae to calculate the tangent. So this is done by approximation, the tangent at the point p(t) is given by the slope of the line between points p(t-dTan) and p(t+dTan).

    • Constructor Detail

      • PathTube

        I_PathGen pathGen,
        float rad,
        int nbrSlices,
        int nbrSegments,
        boolean continuous)
        Create a tube with constant radius.
        Parameters:
        app - the PApplet to draw this shape
        pathGen - the path generator for this shape
        rad - the tube radius
        nbrSlices - number of slices along length
        nbrSegments - number of sections around tube
        continuous - true if the two ends meet

      • getTangent

        public PVector getTangent(float t)
        Get the tangent to the tube at a given point along the tube.
        This calculates an approximation to the point specified. See dTan for details
        Parameters:
        t - >=0 and <=1.0
        Returns:
        tangent vector for position t

      • getNormal

        public PVector getNormal(float t)
        Get the normal vector of the tube at a given point along the tube.
        In fact the normal to a parametric curve in 3D is not a vector but rather a plane. This does an approximation by interpolating between the normal vectors (created when the PathTube was instantiated) either side of 't'.
        Parameters:
        t - >=0 and <1
        Returns:
        the normal PVector at this point

      • setPath

        public void setPath(I_PathGen newPath)

      • restoreShape

        public void restoreShape()
        If the shape is being changed dynamically then the coordinates can become corrupted. Calling this method will recalculate all the mesh coordinates and normals.

      • draw

        public void draw()
        Draw the tube.
        Overrides:
        draw in class Mesh2DCore

      • length

        public float length(float t0,
           float t1,
           int steps)
        Calculate the path length of a section of PathTube curve.
        There is no formula for the exact length of a PathTube curve so any method will always be approximate.
        This method will always 'underestimate' the actual path length. It works by subdividing the PathTube curve into a number of straight line segments and summing their lengths.
        The number of subdivisions can be increased to improve the accuracy of the result but at the cost of additional computation.
        You may want to experiment but 100+ subdivisions normally give quite good results.
        Parameters:
        t0 - start ( >=0.0 and
        t1 - end ( >t0 and <=1.0 )
        steps - number of subdivisions
        Returns:
        length of the curve section

      • length

        public float length(int steps)
        Calculate the path length of the PathTube curve.
        There is no formula for the exact length of a PathTube curve so any method will always be approximate.
        This method will always 'underestimate' the actual path length. It works by subdividing the PathTube curve into a number of straight line segments and summing their lengths.
        The number of subdivisions can be increased to improve the accuracy of the result but at the cost of additional computation.
        You may want to experiment but 200 subdivisions normally give quite good results.
        Parameters:
        steps - number of subdivisions
        Returns:
        length of the curve
